io.blocko.coinstack

Class TransactionSender

  • java.lang.Object
    • io.blocko.coinstack.TransactionSender

  • public class TransactionSender
extends Object
    This class provides a set of utility functions to easily create, build, and send a transaction
    Since:
    3.1
    Author:
    BeomjunJeon

    • Method Detail

      • sendCoin

        public String sendCoin(String receiverAddress,
                       long amount)
                throws IOException,
                       CoinStackException
        A simple utility function to send coin to someone. If you want to handle detail behavior, add an output using TransactionBuilder.addOutput(String, long), tune detail parameters, build transaction using TransactionBuilder.buildTransaction(CoinStackClient, String), and send its result (signed raw transaction) using CoinStackClient.sendTransaction(String)
        Parameters:
        receiverAddress - a target bitcoin address to send coin
        amount - an amount of coin to send in satoshi
        Returns:
        a transaction id
        Throws:
        IOException - network failure
        CoinStackException - something wrong with a transaction

      • writeData

        public String writeData(byte[] data)
                 throws MalformedInputException,
                        IOException,
                        CoinStackException
        A simple utility function to record bytes to coinstack. If you want to handle detail behavior, set data using TransactionBuilder.setData(byte[]), tune detail parameters, build transaction using TransactionBuilder.buildTransaction(CoinStackClient, String), and send its result (signed raw transaction) using CoinStackClient.sendTransaction(String)
        Parameters:
        data - serialized data, that you want to record
        Returns:
        a transaction id
        Throws:
        IOException - network failure
        CoinStackException - something wrong with a transaction
        MalformedInputException

      • sendData

        public String sendData(String dataReceiverAddress,
                       byte[] data)
                throws MalformedInputException,
                       IOException,
                       CoinStackException
        A simple utility function to send data to another. If you want to handle detail behavior, set data using TransactionBuilder.setData(byte[]), add data receiver using TransactionBuilder.addOutput(String, long), tune detail parameters, build transaction using TransactionBuilder.buildTransaction(CoinStackClient, String), and send its result (signed raw transaction) using CoinStackClient.sendTransaction(String)
        Parameters:
        dataReceiverAddress - a target bitcoin address, that you want to let him know data sending
        data - serialized data, that you want to record
        Returns:
        a transaction id
        Throws:
        IOException - network failure
        CoinStackException - something wrong with a transaction
        MalformedInputException

      • defineContract

        public String defineContract(String contractId,
                             LuaContractCode code)
                      throws MalformedInputException,
                             IOException,
                             CoinStackException
        A simple utility function to define a smart contract
        Parameters:
        contractId - a target smart contract id to define
        code - a lua smart contract instance
        Returns:
        a transaction id
        Throws:
        MalformedInputException - the given lua contract code is null
        IOException - network failure
        CoinStackException - something wrong with a transaction

      • executeContract

        public String executeContract(String contractId,
                              LuaContractCode code)
                       throws MalformedInputException,
                              IOException,
                              CoinStackException
        A simple utility function to execute a smart contract
        Parameters:
        contractId - a target smart contract id to define
        code - a lua smart contract instance
        Returns:
        a transaction id
        Throws:
        MalformedInputException - the given lua contract code is null
        IOException - network failure
        CoinStackException - something wrong with a transaction
